        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<!----></span><br><br>Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This is a reland of commit <span class="line"><!---->This is a reland of commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a         Description #1 by harri...@gmail.com (May 18, 2022)
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by harri...@gmail.com (May 18, 2022)
      </option>
    
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by harri...@gmail.com (May 18, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      <div class="select-container">
        <select aria-label="Description history menu" hidden="">
          <!---->
      <option value="0" selected="">
        Description #1 by harri...@gmail.com (May 18, 2022)
      </option>
    <!---->
        </select>
      </div>
      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The "File System Access API"'s block-list on sensitive system locations protecting "FileSystemFileHandle" calls is lackluster and can be bypassed, allowing Chromium to read/write arbitrarily to a users disk.<span class="line"><!---->The "File System Access API"'s block-list on sensitive system locations protecting "FileSystemFileHandle" calls is lackluster and can be bypassed, allowing Chromium to read/write arbitrarily to a users disk.<!----></span><br>On Windows, passing "C:\" to "window.showOpenFilePicker()" is prevented with the warning: "can't open this folder because it contains system files" due to the Chromium block-list:<span class="line"><!---->On Windows, passing "C:\" to "window.showOpenFilePicker()" is prevented with the warning: "can't open this folder because it contains system files" due to the Chromium block-list:<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154<!----></a><br>However, by using UNC path aliases such as "\\localhost\C$", users can be socially engineered into sharing their entire disk with a malicious site.<span class="line"><!---->However, by using UNC path aliases such as "\\localhost\C$", users can be socially engineered into sharing their entire disk with a malicious site.<!----></span><br>This access provides threat actors arbitrary read/write access allowing for instance: reading credentials, planting malware / ransomware by writing code to e.g user startup folders, altering chromium settings etc...<span class="line"><!---->This access provides threat actors arbitrary read/write access allowing for instance: reading credentials, planting malware / ransomware by writing code to e.g user startup folders, altering chromium settings etc...<!----></span><br>Similar bypasses are likely present on other platforms as well, if not for full disk access, but other sensitive locations e.g "~/.bash_history" on Linux.<span class="line"><!---->Similar bypasses are likely present on other platforms as well, if not for full disk access, but other sensitive locations e.g "~/.bash_history" on Linux.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 101.0.4951.67 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 101.0.4951.67 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Microsoft Edge Version: 101.0.1210.47 (Official build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Microsoft Edge Version: 101.0.1210.47 (Official build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See attached .html additionally available live at: <span class="line"><!---->See attached .html additionally available live at: <!----></span>https://harrisonm.com/browser2c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://harrisonm.com/browser2c"><!---->https://harrisonm.com/browser2c<!----></a> (assumes Windows with Chrome/Edge)<span class="line"><!----> (assumes Windows with Chrome/Edge)<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<span class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></span><br>If possible, move to a "allow-list" rather than a "block-list" approach, and consider only allowing user environment folders and below e.g "C:\Users\Username" (or OS equivalent). Alternatively, greater scrutinise the block-list and consider excluding file shares e.g "\\host\share" (or OS equivalent) and other known sensitive locations.<span class="line"><!---->If possible, move to a "allow-list" rather than a "block-list" approach, and consider only allowing user environment folders and below e.g "C:\Users\Username" (or OS equivalent). Alternatively, greater scrutinise the block-list and consider excluding file shares e.g "\\host\share" (or OS equivalent) and other known sensitive locations.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: <span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: <!----></span>harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com"><!---->harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com<!----></a>.au /<span class="line"><!---->.au /<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>harrisonm.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://harrisonm.com"><!---->harrisonm.com<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mek@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/3148124688" title="mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mek@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        In one of the earlier security focused design docs for this feature (<span class="line"><!---->In one of the earlier security focused design docs for this feature (<!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> I wrote "We should reserve this kind of extreme blocklist for very rare cases. If a user very explicitly wants to edit a certain file with a web app, we should probably just let them." which seem to get agreement from the security team.<span class="line"><!----> I wrote "We should reserve this kind of extreme blocklist for very rare cases. If a user very explicitly wants to edit a certain file with a web app, we should probably just let them." which seem to get agreement from the security team.<!----></span><br><br>The list was really meant more as a way to reduce accidental sharing of "too much" or "too sensitive" data, rather than as a way to make it impossible to do things. Using this API for websites to interoperate with other native applications wouldn't work particularly well if we forced users to store their data in specific directories/places.<span class="line"><!---->The list was really meant more as a way to reduce accidental sharing of "too much" or "too sensitive" data, rather than as a way to make it impossible to do things. Using this API for websites to interoperate with other native applications wouldn't work particularly well if we forced users to store their data in specific directories/places.<!----></span><br><br>Having said that, it might be good to do some kind of path normalization before comparing against the block list, although I somehow doubt we'd be able to do normalization that fully blocks access in every way to these paths. Also, if you can convince a user to select a particular file or directory with the file system access API, you can just as well convince the user to do the same for <input type=file> giving the website just as much (read-only) access. And for write access we have safe browsing and mark-of-the-web/quarantine that is supposed to protect against malware etc.<span class="line"><!---->Having said that, it might be good to do some kind of path normalization before comparing against the block list, although I somehow doubt we'd be able to do normalization that fully blocks access in every way to these paths. Also, if you can convince a user to select a particular file or directory with the file system access API, you can just as well convince the user to do the same for &lt;input type=file&gt; giving the website just as much (read-only) access. And for write access we have safe browsing and mark-of-the-web/quarantine that is supposed to protect against malware etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c8">Comment 8<!----></a>

In order to avoid bypassing the blocklist, UNC paths will be blocked on open*Picker() FSA API.<span class="line"><!---->Currently, there is no feasible way to resolve various types of UNC paths into a canonicalized path that can be checked against the existing blocklist.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 06 18:20:53 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 06 18:20:53 2023<!----></span><br><br>[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br><br>The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1326788<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1326788" title="Security: Lackluster &quot;File System Access API&quot; block-list provides full disk read/write access"><!---->Bug: 1326788<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1408321<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1408321" title="Can not save files to cloud or shared file path "><!---->1408321<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I030b2719781ac21a145ceb83ce53e7f129b4ce2f<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I030b2719781ac21a145ceb83ce53e7f129b4ce2f<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4200953<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4200953"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4200953<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Austin Sullivan <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Austin Sullivan &lt;<!----></span>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a>><span &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 06 18:32:14 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 06 18:32:14 2023<!----></span><br><br>Revert "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->Revert "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This reverts commit <span class="line"><!---->This reverts commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>Reason for revert: Missed using CharType instead of char.<span class="line"><!---->Reason for revert: Missed using CharType instead of char.<!----></span><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\...").         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d7bff53e82d9ab435cd6c3d91052b90c3fe7ffd7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d7bff53e82d9ab435cd6c3d91052b90c3fe7ffd7"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/d7bff53e82d9ab435cd6c3d91052b90c3fe7ffd7<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>d7bff53e82d9ab435cd6c3d91052b90c3fe7ffd7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/d7bff53e82d9ab435cd6c3d91052b90c3fe7ffd7"><!---->d7bff53e82d9ab435cd6c3d91052b90c3fe7ffd7<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Feb 07 23:42:17 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Feb 07 23:42:17 2023<!----></span><br><br>[M111] Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->[M111] Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This is a reland of commit <span class="line"><!---->This is a reland of commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<!----></span><br><br>Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This is a reland of commit <span class="line"><!---->This is a reland of commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a       VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The "File System Access API"'s block-list on sensitive system locations protecting "FileSystemFileHandle" calls is lackluster and can be bypassed, allowing Chromium to read/write arbitrarily to a users disk.<span class="line"><!---->The "File System Access API"'s block-list on sensitive system locations protecting "FileSystemFileHandle" calls is lackluster and can be bypassed, allowing Chromium to read/write arbitrarily to a users disk.<!----></span><br>On Windows, passing "C:\" to "window.showOpenFilePicker()" is prevented with the warning: "can't open this folder because it contains system files" due to the Chromium block-list:<span class="line"><!---->On Windows, passing "C:\" to "window.showOpenFilePicker()" is prevented with the warning: "can't open this folder because it contains system files" due to the Chromium block-list:<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154<!----></a><br>However, by using UNC path aliases such as "\\localhost\C$", users can be socially engineered into sharing their entire disk with a malicious site.<span class="line"><!---->However, by using UNC path aliases such as "\\localhost\C$", users can be socially engineered into sharing their entire disk with a malicious site.<!----></span><br>This access provides threat actors arbitrary read/write access allowing for instance: reading credentials, planting malware / ransomware by writing code to e.g user startup folders, altering chromium settings etc...<span class="line"><!---->This access provides threat actors arbitrary read/write access allowing for instance: reading credentials, planting malware / ransomware by writing code to e.g user startup folders, altering chromium settings etc...<!----></span><br>Similar bypasses are likely present on other platforms as well, if not for full disk access, but other sensitive locations e.g "~/.bash_history" on Linux.<span class="line"><!---->Similar bypasses are likely present on other platforms as well, if not for full disk access, but other sensitive locations e.g "~/.bash_history" on Linux.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 101.0.4951.67 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 101.0.4951.67 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Microsoft Edge Version: 101.0.1210.47 (Official build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Microsoft Edge Version: 101.0.1210.47 (Official build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See attached .html additionally available live at: <span class="line"><!---->See attached .html additionally available live at: <!----></span>https://harrisonm.com/browser2c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://harrisonm.com/browser2c"><!---->https://harrisonm.com/browser2c<!----></a> (assumes Windows with Chrome/Edge)<span class="line"><!----> (assumes Windows with Chrome/Edge)<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<span class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></span><br>If possible, move to a "allow-list" rather than a "block-list" approach, and consider only allowing user environment folders and below e.g "C:\Users\Username" (or OS equivalent). Alternatively, greater scrutinise the block-list and consider excluding file shares e.g "\\host\share" (or OS equivalent) and other known sensitive locations.<span class="line"><!---->If possible, move to a "allow-list" rather than a "block-list" approach, and consider only allowing user environment folders and below e.g "C:\Users\Username" (or OS equivalent). Alternatively, greater scrutinise the block-list and consider excluding file shares e.g "\\host\share" (or OS equivalent) and other known sensitive locations.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: <span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: <!----></span>harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com"><!---->harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com<!----></a>.au /<span class="line"><!---->.au /<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>harrisonm.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://harrisonm.com"><!---->harrisonm.com<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>

      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        In one of the earlier security focused design docs for this feature (<span class="line"><!---->In one of the earlier security focused design docs for this feature (<!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> I wrote "We should reserve this kind of extreme blocklist for very rare cases. If a user very explicitly wants to edit a certain file with a web app, we should probably just let them." which seem to get agreement from the security team.<span class="line"><!----> I wrote "We should reserve this kind of extreme blocklist for very rare cases. If a user very explicitly wants to edit a certain file with a web app, we should probably just let them." which seem to get agreement from the security team.<!----></span><br><br>The list was really meant more as a way to reduce accidental sharing of "too much" or "too sensitive" data, rather than as a way to make it impossible to do things. Using this API for websites to interoperate with other native applications wouldn't work particularly well if we forced users to store their data in specific directories/places.<span class="line"><!---->The list was really meant more as a way to reduce accidental sharing of "too much" or "too sensitive" data, rather than as a way to make it impossible to do things. Using this API for websites to interoperate with other native applications wouldn't work particularly well if we forced users to store their data in specific directories/places.<!----></span><br><br>Having said that, it might be good to do some kind of path normalization before comparing against the block list, although I somehow doubt we'd be able to do normalization that fully blocks access in every way to these paths. Also, if you can convince a user to select a particular file or directory with the file system access API, you can just as well convince the user to do the same for <input type=file> giving the website just as much (read-only) access. And for write access we have safe browsing and mark-of-the-web/quarantine that is supposed to protect against malware etc.<span class="line"><!---->Having said that, it might be good to do some kind of path normalization before comparing against the block list, although I somehow doubt we'd be able to do normalization that fully blocks access in every way to these paths. Also, if you can convince a user to select a particular file or directory with the file system access API, you can just as well convince the user to do the same for &lt;input type=file&gt; giving the website just as much (read-only) access. And for write access we have safe browsing and mark-of-the-web/quarantine that is supposed to protect against malware etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37"><!---->915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Nov 01 16:02:36 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Nov 01 16:02:36 2022<!----></span><br><br>[FSA] Reject UNC paths from the file and directory pickers on Windows<span class="line"><!---->[FSA] Reject UNC paths from the file and directory pickers on Windows<!----></span><br><br>Currently, there is no feasible way to resolve various types of UNC paths into a canonicalized path that can be checked against the existing blocklist. In order to avoid bypassing the blocklist, UNC paths will be blocked on open*Picker() FSA API.<span class="line"><!---->Currently, there is no feasible way to resolve various types of UNC paths into a canonicalized path that can be checked against the existing blocklist. In order to avoid bypassing the blocklist, UNC paths will be blocked on open*Picker() FSA API.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1326788<a class="strike-through" target="_blank"         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 06 18:20:53 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 06 18:20:53 2023<!----></span><br><br>[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br><br>The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1326788<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1326788" title="Security:         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/403d13a8451b8a6b75a4d57945e7ada5b5fb52d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/403d13a8451b8a6b75a4d57945e7ada5b5fb52d2"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/403d13a8451b8a6b75a4d57945e7ada5b5fb52d2<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>403d13a8451b8a6b75a4d57945e7ada5b5fb52d2<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/403d13a8451b8a6b75a4d57945e7ada5b5fb52d2"><!---->403d13a8451b8a6b75a4d57945e7ada5b5fb52d2<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 06 21:46:55 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 06 21:46:55 2023<!----></span><br><br>Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This is a reland of commit <span class="line"><!---->This is a reland of commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<!----></span><br><br>Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This is a reland of commit <span class="line"><!---->This is a reland of commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1326788" title="Security: Lackluster &quot;File System Access API&quot; block-list provides full disk read/write access"><!---->Bug: 1326788<!----></a>, <span class="line"><!---->, <!----></span>1408321<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1408321" title="Can not save files to cloud or shared file path "><!---->1408321<!----></a><br>> Change-Id: I030b2719781ac21a145ceb83ce53e7f129b4ce2f<span class="line"><!---->&gt; Change-Id: I030b2719781ac21a145ceb83ce53e7f129b4ce2f<!----></span><br>> Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->&gt; Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4200953<a         Description #1 by harri...@gmail.com (May 18, 2022)

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>The "File System Access API"'s block-list on sensitive system locations protecting "FileSystemFileHandle" calls is lackluster and can be bypassed, allowing Chromium to read/write arbitrarily to a users disk.<span class="line"><!---->The "File System Access API"'s block-list on sensitive system locations protecting "FileSystemFileHandle" calls is lackluster and can be bypassed, allowing Chromium to read/write arbitrarily to a users disk.<!----></span><br>On Windows, passing "C:\" to "window.showOpenFilePicker()" is prevented with the warning: "can't open this folder because it contains system files" due to the Chromium block-list:<span class="line"><!---->On Windows, passing "C:\" to "window.showOpenFilePicker()" is prevented with the warning: "can't open this folder because it contains system files" due to the Chromium block-list:<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/refs/heads/master/chrome/browser/file_system_access/chrome_file_system_access_permission_context.cc#154<!----></a><br>However, by using UNC path aliases such as "\\localhost\C$", users can be socially engineered into sharing their entire disk with a malicious site.<span class="line"><!---->However, by using UNC path aliases such as "\\localhost\C$", users can be socially engineered into sharing their entire disk with a malicious site.<!----></span><br>This access provides threat actors arbitrary read/write access allowing for instance: reading credentials, planting malware / ransomware by writing code to e.g user startup folders, altering chromium settings etc...<span class="line"><!---->This access provides threat actors arbitrary read/write access allowing for instance: reading credentials, planting malware / ransomware by writing code to e.g user startup folders, altering chromium settings etc...<!----></span><br>Similar bypasses are likely present on other platforms as well, if not for full disk access, but other sensitive locations e.g "~/.bash_history" on Linux.<span class="line"><!---->Similar bypasses are likely present on other platforms as well, if not for full disk access, but other sensitive locations e.g "~/.bash_history" on Linux.<!----></span><br><br>VERSION<b class="line"><!---->VERSION<!----></b><br>Chrome Version: 101.0.4951.67 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<span class="line"><!---->Chrome Version: 101.0.4951.67 (Official Build) (64-bit) (cohort: Stable)<!----></span><br>Microsoft Edge Version: 101.0.1210.47 (Official build) (64-bit)<span class="line"><!---->Microsoft Edge Version: 101.0.1210.47 (Official build) (64-bit)<!----></span><br>Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044<span class="line"><!---->Operating System: Microsoft Windows 10 Enterprise 10.0.19044 N/A Build 19044<!----></span><br><br>REPRODUCTION CASE<b class="line"><!---->REPRODUCTION CASE<!----></b><br>See attached .html additionally available live at: <span class="line"><!---->See attached .html additionally available live at: <!----></span>https://harrisonm.com/browser2c<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://harrisonm.com/browser2c"><!---->https://harrisonm.com/browser2c<!----></a> (assumes Windows with Chrome/Edge)<span class="line"><!----> (assumes Windows with Chrome/Edge)<!----></span><br><br>SUGGESTED FIX<span class="line"><!---->SUGGESTED FIX<!----></span><br>If possible, move to a "allow-list" rather than a "block-list" approach, and consider only allowing user environment folders and below e.g "C:\Users\Username" (or OS equivalent). Alternatively, greater scrutinise the block-list and consider excluding file shares e.g "\\host\share" (or OS equivalent) and other known sensitive locations.<span class="line"><!---->If possible, move to a "allow-list" rather than a "block-list" approach, and consider only allowing user environment folders and below e.g "C:\Users\Username" (or OS equivalent). Alternatively, greater scrutinise the block-list and consider excluding file shares e.g "\\host\share" (or OS equivalent) and other known sensitive locations.<!----></span><br><br>CREDIT INFORMATION<b class="line"><!---->CREDIT INFORMATION<!----></b><br>Reporter credit: <span class="line"><!---->Reporter credit: <!----></span>harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com"><!---->harrison.mitchell@cybercx.com<!----></a>.au /<span class="line"><!---->.au /<!----></span> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>harrisonm.com<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://harrisonm.com"><!---->harrisonm.com<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          Comment 5<a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      mek@chromium.org<a id="user-link" href="/u/3148124688" title="mek@chromium.org"><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></a>
      mek@chromium.org<span id="user-text" hidden=""><!---->mek@chromium.org<!----></span>
      <div id="availability-text" class="availability-notice" title="undefined" hidden=""><!----><!----></div>
    <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        
      Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT
    <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          Project Member<span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      <div role="heading" class="comment-header" aria-level="2">
        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1326788#c5">Comment 5<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>
        on
        <chops-timestamp title="Thu, May 19, 2022, 12:04 AM EDT"></chops-timestamp>
        
          <span class="role-label">Project Member</span>
      
        </div>
        
      </div>
    
      
        
        
      
        In one of the earlier security focused design docs for this feature (<span class="line"><!---->In one of the earlier security focused design docs for this feature (<!----></span>https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing"><!---->https://docs.google.com/document/d/1v5_DoJm7TpmQJkE2dbUDX6ecDZtK7aA2DJAH8Y8WsvQ/edit?usp=sharing<!----></a>)<span class="line"><!---->)<!----></span> I wrote "We should reserve this kind of extreme blocklist for very rare cases. If a user very explicitly wants to edit a certain file with a web app, we should probably just let them." which seem to get agreement from the security team.<span class="line"><!----> I wrote "We should reserve this kind of extreme blocklist for very rare cases. If a user very explicitly wants to edit a certain file with a web app, we should probably just let them." which seem to get agreement from the security team.<!----></span><br><br>The list was really meant more as a way to reduce accidental sharing of "too much" or "too sensitive" data, rather than as a way to make it impossible to do things. Using this API for websites to interoperate with other native applications wouldn't work particularly well if we forced users to store their data in specific directories/places.<span class="line"><!---->The list was really meant more as a way to reduce accidental sharing of "too much" or "too sensitive" data, rather than as a way to make it impossible to do things. Using this API for websites to interoperate with other native applications wouldn't work particularly well if we forced users to store their data in specific directories/places.<!----></span><br><br>Having said that, it might be good to do some kind of path normalization before comparing against the block list, although I somehow doubt we'd be able to do normalization that fully blocks access in every way to these paths. Also, if you can convince a user to select a particular file or directory with the file system access API, you can just as well convince the user to do the same for <input type=file> giving the website just as much (read-only) access. And for write access we have safe browsing and mark-of-the-web/quarantine that is supposed to protect against malware etc.<span class="line"><!---->Having said that, it might be good to do some kind of path normalization before comparing against the block list, although I somehow doubt we'd be able to do normalization that fully blocks access in every way to these paths. Also, if you can convince a user to select a particular file or directory with the file system access API, you can just as well convince the user to do the same for &lt;input type=file&gt; giving the website just as much (read-only) access. And for write access we have safe browsing and mark-of-the-web/quarantine that is supposed to protect against malware etc.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37"><!---->915abdbb04e2d71e288a87786a5293a83080db37<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Tue Nov 01 16:02:36 2022<span class="line"><!---->Date: Tue Nov 01 16:02:36 2022<!----></span><br><br>[FSA] Reject UNC paths from the file and directory pickers on Windows<span class="line"><!---->[FSA] Reject UNC paths from the file and directory pickers on Windows<!----></span><br><br>Currently, there is no feasible way to resolve various types of UNC paths into a canonicalized path that can be checked against the existing blocklist. In order to avoid bypassing the blocklist, UNC paths will be blocked on open*Picker() FSA API.<span class="line"><!---->Currently, there is no feasible way to resolve various types of UNC paths into a canonicalized path that can be checked against the existing blocklist.         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 06 18:20:53 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 06 18:20:53 2023<!----></span><br><br>[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br><br>The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br><br>Bug: 1326788<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1326788" title="Security: class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=1408321" title="Can not save files to cloud or shared file path "><!---->1408321<!----></a><br>Change-Id: I030b2719781ac21a145ceb83ce53e7f129b4ce2f<span class="line"><!---->Change-Id: I030b2719781ac21a145ceb83ce53e7f129b4ce2f<!----></span><br>Reviewed-on: <span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-on: <!----></span>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4200953<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4200953"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/4200953<!----></a><br>Reviewed-by: Austin Sullivan <<span class="line"><!---->Reviewed-by: Austin Sullivan &lt;<!----></span>asully@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/asully@chromium.org"><!---->asully@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Commit-Queue: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Commit-Queue: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank"
