href="https://crrev.com/0f9b05df02296253562df4d3155fb9e79ea7927b"><!---->0f9b05df02296253562df4d3155fb9e79ea7927b<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Mon Feb 06 18:32:14 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Mon Feb 06 18:32:14 2023<!----></span><br><br>Revert "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->Revert "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This reverts commit <span class="line"><!---->This reverts commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><br><br>Reason for revert: Missed using CharType instead of char.<span class="line"><!---->Reason for revert: Missed using CharType instead of char.<!----></span><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may         The following revision refers to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->The following revision refers to this bug:<!----></span><br>  <span class="line"><!---->  <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br><br>commit <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709"><!---->8112f045a8c00aca00032fa057be0da38a9c1709<!----></a><br>Author: Daseul Lee <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Daseul Lee &lt;<!----></span>dslee@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/dslee@chromium.org"><!---->dslee@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<span class="line"><!---->Date: Fri Feb 10 18:55:06 2023<!----></span><br><br>Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<span class="line"><!---->Reland "[FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows."<!----></span><br><br>This is a reland of commit <span class="line"><!---->This is a reland of commit <!----></span>01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51"><!---->01d8e55690c9f59f58c5ae1361d707f08a33be51<!----></a><br><br>Original change's description:<span class="line"><!---->Original change's description:<!----></span><br>> [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; [FSA] Update UNC path rejection to only local UNC path on Windows.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; The previous check `PathIsUNC()` was too broad and included both external/network UNC path as well as local UNC path (i.e. "\\LOCALHOST\c$\..."). As we want to avoid different variants of "local" UNC from bypassing the blocklist check (and that we currently do not have any blocklist on external path), external UNC path will be allowed again with this change. Unfortunately, there is no complete way to normalize different variations of Windows path, so we use some heuristics by checking (1) UNC root via `base::FilePath::IsNetwork()`, (2) hostname, which may represent local system and (3) `$` character in share name.<!----></span><br>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>> <span class="line"><!---->&gt; <!----></span>Bug: 1326788<a        Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">
      
        <slot></slot>
      <label for="checkbox">
        <slot></slot>
      </label>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
